result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor L Feltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.
  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay Restitution of $2,907.25
Pay a minimum of $100 per month towards restitution.

Pay costs and DNA surcharge(s). If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage in any other counseling as deemed approrpriate by the agent.
No contact with victim with exception of letter of apology, to be written within first 30 days of probation, then given to agent for review before forwarding.
16CF-27 may be expunged upon successful completion of probation and with recommendation of agent.
May be discharged from probation after 2 years, after successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevor L Feltz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CM-163, 15CM-181 and 16CF-27.

3:56 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
State files an amended information in 16CF-27.

16CF-27: Count 1 and Count 2 Defendant will plead to.
15CM-181: Count 1 and Count 2 Defendant will plead to.
14CM-163: Defendant previously plead 

State provides restitution summary for both 16CF-27 and 15CM-181.

Atty Drengler concurs with agreement.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the amended information in 16CF-27, waives reading and is prepared to enter pleas.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF-27: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 16CF-27: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-181: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-181: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim impact statement was submitted.
There are no victims here today.
Atty Drengler received a copy of the impact statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CF-27: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein - amended
16CF-27: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein - amended
15CM-181: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-181: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-181: Count 3: Dismissed and read in
15CM-181: Count 4: Dismissed and read in
Court previousy accepted the plea in 14CM-163 without a finding of guilty, was placed in the VIP. VIP has been revoked and Court directs the Clerk to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Contrary to the statute section stated therein

4:13 PM Court takes a moment to read the victim impact statement.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court, believes the joint recommendation is appropriate.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, believes the joint recommendation is appropriate. 

Court questions Defendant.
Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court addresses restitution to Defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM-163:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed
First 20 days in jail, second 20 may be on electronic monitoring if aproved by jail and risk assessment tool
Probation for a period of 12 months 
Conditions:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CM-181:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 250 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to 14CM-163
First 125 must be in jail, second 125 may be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool
Probation for a period of  2 years concurrent to 14CM-163
3 days jail credit
Conditions: 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Restitution of $3,445.33
Pay a minimum of $200 per month towards restitution
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if not had one within the past 12 months
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any dangerous weapons
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
No contact with victims except for writing a letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation, to be forwarded to agent first before going to victims

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 250 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1, and 14CM-163
Probation for  a period of 2 years, concurrent to Count 1 and 14CM-163
3 days jail credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and 14CM-163
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CF-27:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years concurrent to 14CM-163 and 15CM-181
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Restitution of $2,907.25
Pay a minimum of $100 per month towards restitution
Jail sentence for 10 days
Huber granted for employment and any counseling he may be involved in, to be served within the first 60 days of probation. Agent can set up a start date and time
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess any dangerous weapons
Engage in any other counseling as deemed approrpriate by the agent
No contact with victim with exception of letter of apology, to be written within first 30 days of probation, then given to agent for review before forwarding

Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1, 14CM-163 and 15CM-181
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1, 14CM-163 and 15CM-181
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Jail sentence for 10 days, concurrent to Count 1.
Huber granted for employment and any counseling he may be involved in, to be served within the first 60 days of probation. Agent can set up a start date and time
Submit DNA sample

16CF-27 may be expunged upon successful completion of probation and with recommendation of agent.

May be discharged from probation after 2 years, after successful completion of probation.

20 days in which to appeal the cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Trevor L Feltz in court with attorney Acalia Halverson appearing on behalf of Atty Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:25 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
